publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3413# Karen Whitefield: Eco-Schools-That the Parliament recognises the value of the Eco-Schools programme in promoting environmental education and encouraging young people to make a difference to their local communities; congratulates those teachers who, through their hard work and enthusiasm, are making the programme a success across Scotland; hopes that more schools will register an interest in the project, and considers that the Executive should continue to give its support to such initiatives which encourage citizenship and environmental awareness.

S1M-3413# Karen Whitefield: Eco-Schools-That the Parliament recognises the value of the Eco-Schools programme in promoting environmental education and encouraging young people to make a difference to their local communities; congratulates those teachers who, through their hard work and enthusiasm, are making the programme a success across Scotland; hopes that more schools will register an interest in the project, and considers that the Executive should continue to give its support to such initiatives which encourage citizenship and environmental awareness. Supported by: Sarah Boyack*
S1M-3413# Eco-Schools (lodged on 19 September 2002) Pauline McNeill*

S1M-3413# Eco-Schools (lodged on 19 September 2002) Scott Barrie*, Johann Lamont*, Cathy Peattie*, Kate Maclean*, Margaret Jamieson*, Brian Fitzpatrick*, Cathie Craigie*, Mr Tom McCabe*, Mr Alasdair Morrison*, Jackie Baillie*, Paul Martin*, Robin Harper*, Mr Michael McMahon*, Mr Keith Harding*, Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Maureen Macmillan*, Mr John McAllion*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Helen Eadie*
S1M-3413# Eco-Schools (lodged on 19 September 2002) Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Elaine Smith*, Fiona McLeod*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Tavish Scott*, Dennis Canavan*, Marilyn Livingstone*

S1M-3413# Eco-Schools (lodged on 19 September 2002) Nora Radcliffe*, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-3413# Eco-Schools (lodged on 19 September 2002) Karen Gillon*
S1M-3413# Eco-Schools (lodged on 19 September 2002) Rhona Brankin*
